abstract: Warburg Pincus reportedly exited its stake in the Chinese juice company Huiyuan, making it the first major shareholder to withdraw since China blocked Huiyuan’s sale to Coca-Cola.
snippet: Warburg Pincus reportedly exited its stake in the Chinese juice company Huiyuan, making it the first major shareholder to withdraw since China blocked Huiyuan’s sale to Coca-Cola.
lead_paragraph: Warburg Pincus, the private equity firm, has reportedly abandoned its stake in the Chinese juice company Huiyuan, which would make it the first major shareholder to pull its investment out of Huiyuan since the Chinese government decided to block its $2.4 billion sale to Coca-Cola.

headline.main: Warburg Pincus Said to Quit Huiyuan Investment
